Name: GRUB 2 , URL: /wiki/GNU_GRUB
Supported architecture: x86 (PC, EFI, UEFI, coreboot, OLPC), IA-64, ARM (U-Boot, UEFI), PowerPC (OpenFirmware), MIPS, SPARC (SPARC v9)

Name: FreeBSD , URL: /wiki/FreeBSD
Supported architecture: x86 (PC, EFI, UEFI, coreboot, OLPC), ARM (U-Boot, UEFI), MIPS, PowerPC, SPARC v9

Name: LOLO (Logic PD)
Supported architecture: ARM7, ARM9, ARM11, Cortex-A8, StrongARM, SH, ColdFire
Others: Supported devices: MCF54xx, MCF5329, MCF5373, LLH7A400, LLH7A404, LLH79520, LLH79524, LSH7727, LSH7750, LSH7760, PXA270, PXA320, IMX31, IMX27, OMAP35xx, OMAP37xx

Name: BOOTBOOT
Supported architecture: x86-64 (PC, UEFI, El Torito CDROM, BSS Expansion ROM, UEFI Option ROM), ARM AArch64 (Raspberry Pi 3 and up)
Others: comes with a multiplatform, dependency-free bootable hybrid image creator (FOSS)

Name: RedBoot , URL: /wiki/RedBoot
Supported architecture: ARM, ColdFire, H8300, x86, Freescale/Motorola 68000, MIPS, PowerPC, SH, SPARC, SPARCLite

Name: Das U-Boot , URL: /wiki/Das_U-Boot
Supported executable: EFI, ELF, U-Boot image format, Linux zImage, raw
Supported protocol: TFTP, NFS, serial (S-Record, Y-Modem, Kermit binary protocol)

Name: Barebox , URL: /wiki/Barebox
Supported protocol: TFTP, NFS, serial (S-Record, Y-Modem, Kermit binary protocol)

Name: Linux kexec
Supported architecture: x86, ARM, ARM64, PowerPC 64, IA-64, IBM Z[13]
Supported protocol: Depending on configuration and user space
Others: The kexec system call can start another kernel, replacing the current running Linux, thus turning a Linux-based operating system into a fancy bootloader.

Name: Windows Boot Manager , URL: /wiki/Windows_Boot_Manager
Supported architecture: x86 (PC), ARM (only on Windows Mobile remake)
Others: Successor of NTLDR; used on Vista and up.
